title: NewsBlaze Exclusive: Interview with heroic leader Khalifa Omar Moaalim Nour on El-Dheer's embrace of freedom
text:
EL-DHEER, Somalia, Dec. 30, 2023 /PRNewswire/ — In a remarkable turn of events, the Somalian city of El-Dheer, once held captive by al-Shabab's repressive regime for 16 years, is now resting Is. The glow of new found freedom and peace. Government forces, in collaboration with local freedom fighters, successfully liberated the city, achieving a significant victory over the notorious terrorist group.
Caliph Omar Moalim Noor, leader of local Somali freedom fighters in al-Dheer, a former stronghold of al-Shabaab pirates.
NewsBlaze.com senior journalist Shafiei Mohyeddin Abokar had the privilege of conducting an exclusive interview with the charismatic leader of local freedom fighters, Khalifa Omar Moalim Noor. Despite the challenges, Caliph Omar Moalim Noor and his forces played a key role in expelling al-Shabaab militants from al-Dheer, ending years of al-Shabaab brutality.
Read the whole story here:
[Al Shabaab Reign Ends in Somali Town as Govt Forces End 16-Year Brutality]
The interview, conducted via phone from Khalifa's base in a remote area outside al-Dheer, provides a unique insight into the operation and ongoing efforts to eliminate any remaining al-Shabaab remnants in the area.
Khalif expressed cautious optimism about the future, and stressed the commitment to continue the fight until the entire central Galgaduud region is freed from the clutches of terrorism. The leader underlined the importance of witnessing change firsthand, inviting local and international media to witness the reemergence of normalcy in El-Dheer and neighboring areas.
Taking strategic control of coastal areas exposed the Caliphate as a significant blow to al-Shabaab, leaving them landlocked and disrupting their ability to escape or import vital supplies. The liberation of Igo and Marig ports, once under the control of militants, marks a turning point in the fight against al-Shabaab.
Residents, who endured so much hardship, can now slowly experience a return to normalcy. Some medical care has been restored, and the reopening of the city hospital is evidence of positive changes. However, challenges remain, and schools are in need of repairs and instructional materials. The international community is urged to support the recovery of the region, including by assisting in the reconstruction of what was destroyed during the years of al-Shabaab rule.
As the world witnesses the victory of resilience over terror in Al-Dheer, Newsblaze is committed to bringing stories of hope and recovery from areas emerging from the shadow of conflict.
